clinical_study.brief_title: Surgical APGAR Score and Modified Surgical APGAR Score
clinical_study.official_title: Comparison of Surgical APGAR Score and Modified Surgical APGAR Score in Predicting Possible Postoperative Complications in Major Surgery
clinical_study.source: Prof. Dr. Cemil Tascıoglu Education and Research Hospital Organization

brief_summary.textblock: In this study we aimed to define a new modified SAS is to predict the incidence of postoperative complication and mortality in major abdominal and orthopedic surgery. We also identify the effectivity of this modified scoring system composed of the duration of operation in addition to the three intraoperative parameters of SAS.

primary_outcome.measure: Comparison of Surgical APGAR Score and Modified Surgical APGAR Score in Predicting Possible Postoperative Complications in Major Surgery
primary_outcome.description: Operation time should be included as a simple, objective and practical indication of the SAS risk score in the major operations in our study including a single-center, prospective 308 case study, as it can be seen as an independent predictor of postoperative mortality and complications.

intervention.description: Four intraoperative factors Lowest heart rate (HR), Lowest mean arterial pressure (MAP) Estimated blood loss Operation time

study_pop.textblock:
Patients who underwent elective major surgery (Abdominal and Orthopedic surgery) were included (n=308)
After the operation modified SAS (mSAS) was calculated by adding the duration of the operation to data used in calculation of the SAS (Table 1.).
Observed complications and related conditions were also noted.
Table 1. Modified Surgical Apgar Score (mSAS)
mSAS 0 1 2 3 4
Estimated blood loss, ml >1000 601-1000 101-600 ≤100 -
Lowest MAP*, mmHg <40 40-54 55-69 ≥70 -
Lowest HR**, beats per min >85 76-85 66-75 56-65 ≤55
Time -4 -3 -2 -1 0
Duration of operation (hour) >8 7.01-8 5.01-7 3.01-5 0-3
* MAP=Mean arterial pressure

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Subject has major surgery
- More than 18 years
Exclusion Criteria:
- Pregnant
- Younger than 18
